name: Increasing trend in erroneous call rate
description: This rule checks a presence of an increasing trend in a given metric. The rule is tuned to detect weakly monotonous increases in the given metric. The detector is however not strict and tolerates certain amount of decreases in the metric value inside the trend candidate.

1. Analyze the data and identify the specific time period when the error occurred.
2. Check if there are any unusual spikes or anomalies in the data during that time period.
3. Investigate whether there were any changes in the system or application environment around the same time.
4. If an anomaly is found, investigate the root cause and take appropriate action to address it.
5. Once the issue has been resolved, monitor the system closely for a few days to ensure that the error does not recur.
6. If the error persists, consider implementing additional monitoring and alerting mechanisms to detect and address trends in real-time.



These questions and answers aim to provide a general understanding of how to approach and troubleshoot issues related to increasing trend detectors in a system. However, the best way to learn and understand these concepts is by working with real-world examples and hands-on experience.
